alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 9:44PM EDT until August 12 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Johnston and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 944 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Goldsboro, Mount Olive, Fremont, Walnut Creek, Pikeville, Seven Springs, Mar-Mac, Brogden, Elroy, Nahunta, Cliffs Of The Neuse State Park and Grantham. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
